fields.label: Emergency Procedure
fields.options:
a) Upon discovering a fire:
  • Activate the nearest fire alarm.
  • Call the local emergency number and provide the building address and location of the fire.
  • Notify Building Management.

b) Upon hearing the fire alarm:
  • Evacuate the building using the nearest safe exit.
  • Do not use elevators.
  • Close doors behind you to prevent the spread of smoke and fire.
  • Proceed to the designated assembly area outside the building.

c) Firefighting:
  • Only attempt to extinguish a fire if it is small and manageable, and you have been trained in the proper use of a fire extinguisher.
  • Ensure that you have a safe exit before attempting to fight the fire.

fields.label: Roles and Responsibility
fields.options:
a) Building Management:
  • Regularly inspect and maintain fire protection systems.
  • Ensure fire safety equipment is in good working condition.
  • Coordinate fire drills and training for building occupants.
  • Update and distribute the Fire Safety Plan to all occupants.

b) Building Occupants:
  • Familiarize yourself with the Fire Safety Plan and emergency procedures.
  • Participate in fire drills and training.
  • Report any fire hazards or malfunctioning fire safety equipment to Building Management.

fields.label: Fire Prevention Measures
fields.options:
a) Housekeeping:
  • Keep hallways and stairwells clear of obstructions.
  • Store flammable materials in approved containers and designated areas.
  • Dispose of waste materials in appropriate receptacles.

b) Electrical Safety:
  • Do not overload electrical outlets or extension cords.
  • Replace damaged electrical cords or plugs.
  • Keep electrical appliances away from flammable materials.

c) Smoking:
  • Adhere to designated smoking areas and dispose of smoking materials properly.
  • Do not smoke in non-smoking areas or near flammable materials.

fields.label: Fire Safety Equipment
fields.options:
a) Fire extinguishers:
  • Ensure fire extinguishers are accessible, visible, and properly maintained.
  • Train designated personnel in the proper use of fire extinguishers.

b) Fire alarm systems:
  • Regularly test and maintain fire alarm systems.
  • Ensure all occupants are familiar with the sound of the alarm and know how to respond.

c) Sprinkler systems:
  • Regularly inspect and maintain sprinkler systems.
  • Ensure sprinkler heads are unobstructed and in good working order.
